title: Ticket #1219: ConcurrencyLimit problems with new ClassAds
description:
I noticed that condor_q from the current 7.5.1 build is unable to run -better-analyze in CHTC (CM 7.5.0). The failure is caused by entries such as the following in the negotiator's classad response to GET_PRIORITY: 

ConcurrencyLimit.jmag = 0.0

This causes condor_q to report: 

Could not get priorities from negotiator

The code that produces these entries appears to be this in Accountant.cpp: 

        attr.sprintf("ConcurrencyLimit.%s = %f\n", limit.Value(), count);

In new classads, "." is not a valid character in an attribute name, so condor_q cannot parse the classad. Presumably if the negotiator were using new classads, it would fail to insert these attributes into the ad, but it ignores the return value of Insert(), so this information would simply be missing.
remarks:
2010-Feb-16 08:54:04 by matt:
The dot (.) is an arbitrary separator. An underscore (_) or colon (:) would also work. I have some code that depends on the dot, which I can update. I do not expect many others have code that rely on dot. Ideally we can pick a stable separator now. In the future we can likely use a nested ClassAd.

2010-Feb-16 09:14:53 by jfrey:
I can't find any code that looks up these ConcurrencyLimit.<blah> attributes. In the new ClassAds compatibility layer, getOldClassAdNoTypes() and getOldClassAd() could check for these names and convert the '.' to '_'.

2010-Feb-16 10:30:40 by jfrey:
I've attached a patch to fix this specific problem. The accountant would use '_' instead of '.' in the ConcurrencyLimit attributes. And the compatibility layer would convert '.' to '_' if it sees these specific attributes come over the wire. I've tested the second half of the patch against a 7.5.0 negotiator.

2010-Feb-16 10:34:54 by matt:
That looks like the change I would have made.

2010-Feb-16 10:41:48 by jfrey:
I've pushed the patch to V7_5_1-branch.
attachments:
• dot.patch 1086 bytes added by jfrey on 2010-Feb-16 16:28:46 UTC.
    Patch to remove '.' from attribute names in accountant.
check_ins: 2010-Feb-16 10:36   Check-in [17255]: Change '.' to '_' in ConcurrencyLimit attrs in Accountant. #1219 The accountant would create user priority ads with attributes named ConcurrencyLimit.foo. New ClassAds' stricter checking of attribute names chokes on this, causing condor_userprio and condor_q -analyze to fail if these attributes are present. [...] (By Jaime Frey )
creator: danb
